channel.title: Port Forwarding
channel.description:
Ok I think I Port Forwarded mostly correct, but when I go to canyouseeme.org I get this message: Error: I could not see your service on (MY IP) on port (43594)
Can someone help? What all programs do I run to make sure I forwarded my port correctly?

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @yesimanub yesimanub
item.description:
@yesimanub wrote:

[quote=“GodexCAB, post:1, topic:518082”]Ok I think I Port Forwarded mostly correct, but when I go to canyouseeme.org I get this message:
Error: I could not see your service on (MY IP) on port (43594)

Can someone help? What all programs do I run to make sure I forwarded my port correctly?[/quote]

portforward on both udp and tcp
than go to windows firewall and add exception for port 43594 for both output and input
add the exception for both udp and tcp

so under incoming you should have 2 columns, 1 label 43594 for tcp and 1 for udp
same goes out outgoing or output or whatever the hell it’s called.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Rsps only runs on tpc. Make sure the server in on when you check.

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @GodexCAB GodexCAB
item.description:
@GodexCAB wrote:

Lil_Smok3r:

Are you sure you’ve done both UDP and TCP?

I’m not quite sure. This is my first time port forwarding. I used Hamachi and didn’t need to port forward, and I don’t like using Hamachi.
Can you please explain from the beginning how to port forward? PlEASE.

Read full topic
